author: Justin Terranova
title: Mike Francesa plays Santa Claus to crying Mets fan
text:
Who says Mike Francesa doesn’t have a heart?
A day after Francesa dismissed a crying caller who was distraught over the Chase Utley takeout slide of Ruben Tejada, the WFAN host got him back on the air and got him the best seat in the house for Monday night’s NLDS Game 3 between the Mets and Dodgers.
Francesa gave “Will from Queens” a ticket behind home plate — next to Francesa — for the pivotal playoff showdown.
“I don’t know what to say,” a shocked Will said. “I’ll be there.”
The caller became an Internet laughingstock for his reaction to the controversial play and his hope that Matt Harvey would carry the team on Monday night.
“This is his one chance,” Will had said Sunday of Harvey before breaking down.

“Put your team on your shoulders and then you got my faith back in you,” Will exclaimed.
And now Will is going to be there in his Harvey jersey to watch the right-hander try to do just that.
